DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Interpretation Performed Observation Outcome Abnormal Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Specifies whether an interpreted event is abnormal.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Interpretation Performed Observation Outcome Abnormal Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language. Examples of interpretation include rendering by the psychotherapist the latent or hidden meaning of what the patient says, does, or experiences in understandable to him format; the conception of another's behavior; the establishment of significance of something; the result of EKG tracing reading.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Examples of interpretation include rendering by the psychotherapist the latent or hidden meaning of what the patient says, does, or experiences in understandable to him format; the conception of another's behavior; the establishment of significance of something; the result of EKG tracing reading.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

An act or process of elucidation, explication, or explanation of the meaning of an event or thing.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
